document.title: Mapping SAML roles to app RBAC without breaking sessions
document.summary: Practical lessons from aligning Shibboleth SAML assertions with fine-grained RBAC scopes in CyberRange.

body.raw:
Keeping campus identity providers in sync with application roles can go sideways quickly—especially when you introduce per-action audit requirements. This post outlines the guardrails we applied while wiring UMBC’s Shibboleth IdP to the CyberRange portal.

## Start with a role contract

Before writing code, agree on a contract with the identity team. We specified:

- Canonical attribute names (`urn:oid:1.3.6.1.4.1.5923.1.5.1.1` for eduPersonAffiliation)
- Allowed values per attribute and what scopes they unlock
- Expected NameID format (transient vs. persistent)

## Map to scopes, not UI roles

We maintained a `scopes.json` that translated IdP roles to backend capabilities. The UI simply asked the API: “Does this user have `labs:power:cycle`?” That separation prevented awkward UI drift when the identity team renamed groups.

## Harden the session lifecycle

- Cookies set to `SameSite=strict`, `HttpOnly`, and `Secure`
- AES-encrypted session payload with rotating keys stored in HashiCorp Vault
- CSRF double-submit tokens on all mutation routes

## Audit everything

We streamed sensitive events (console open, template clone, role change) to Mongo change streams and persisted them in Postgres for reporting. Every audit record links to the original SAML assertion, making compliance reviews painless.

## Wrap-up

The end result: faculty now approve lab access with confidence that session state and RBAC scopes move in lockstep with campus identity.

document.title: vCenter golden templates playbook
document.summary: How we standardized VMware lab images with post-provision scripts, compliance checks, and automated health reporting.

body.raw:
Faculty needed consistent lab environments that could reset every week without manual babysitting. Golden templates gave us the consistency we wanted, but the playbook required a few careful steps.

## Step 1: Build immutable baselines

Start with a clean OS install, capture checksums, and run CIS hardening scripts. Every template gets a metadata file explaining who built it, what scripts ran, and which courses consume it.

## Step 2: Post-provision customization

A provisioning worker triggers PowerCLI + Ansible scripts immediately after cloning:

- Inject course-specific SSH keys and jump-host routes
- Register agents for logging/metrics
- Run smoke tests (DNS, outbound, identity) before marking the VM as ready

## Step 3: Continuous validation

A nightly job rehydrates sample VMs from each template, runs compliance scans, and feeds the results into Grafana dashboards. If drift appears, we can flag the template, notify owners, and block new labs until it’s healthy.

## Step 4: Retirement workflow

When a template ages out, we snapshot it, store the artifacts in object storage, and document the replacement in the knowledge base. Faculty see the impact in the portal release notes, keeping everyone aligned.

Templates went from “mystery meat” to a predictable, observable backbone for CyberRange labs.

document.title: About
document.description: Full-stack engineer and AI enthusiast with expertise in cloud platforms, machine learning, and system architecture.

body.raw:
## Full-Stack Engineer & AI Enthusiast

I'm Nithin Reddy Poola, a software engineer passionate about building scalable systems, AI-powered applications, and cloud-native solutions. Currently pursuing my Master's in Computer Science at UMBC, I specialize in full-stack development, machine learning, and cloud architecture.

My experience spans from building production-ready platforms like the UMBC CyberRange Portal to developing AI-powered interview systems and predictive analytics applications. I thrive on solving complex technical challenges and creating impactful solutions that make a difference.

## Experience

### Software Engineer Intern — UMBC College of Engineering & IT (2023 – 2024)
- Architected and shipped the **CyberRange Portal**, replacing manual VMware scripts with a self-service Next.js platform
- Automated vCenter provisioning, SAML SSO mappings, Docker/NGINX deployments, logging, and metrics pipelines
- Reduced lab onboarding from weeks to minutes while satisfying FERPA audit requirements
- Provisioned 100+ VMs/week with zero PII incidents and 90% faster lab setup

### Graduate Assistant & Grader — UMBC (2023)
- Supported CMSC 481 (Computational Models) coursework with systems-focused labs and tutorials
- Assisted students with complex algorithmic problems and computational theory concepts

### Web Development Intern — Oasis Infobyte (Remote) (2022)
- Delivered responsive React dashboards and REST APIs for client projects
- Implemented modern frontend architectures with component-based design
- Collaborated with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality web applications

### Data Science Intern — Small Talk (Remote) (2021)
- Built predictive models and dashboards supporting customer engagement analytics
- Developed data pipelines for processing and analyzing large datasets
- Created visualization tools for business intelligence reporting

## Technical Skills

### Languages & Frameworks
- **Frontend**: React, Next.js, TypeScript, JavaScript, Tailwind CSS, Material-UI
- **Backend**: Node.js, Express, Python, FastAPI, Django
- **Mobile**: React Native
- **Database**: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis

### Cloud & DevOps
- **Cloud Platforms**: Azure (AI-102, DP-100 certified), AWS
- **Containerization**: Docker, Kubernetes
- **CI/CD**: GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps
- **Infrastructure**: VMware vCenter, PowerCLI, Terraform, NGINX

### AI & Machine Learning
- **Frameworks**: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Scikit-learn
- **Azure AI**: Azure OpenAI, Azure ML, Cognitive Services
- **Tools**: LangChain, MLflow, Hugging Face
- **Specializations**: NLP, Computer Vision, Time Series Forecasting, LSTM Networks

### Security & Authentication
- **Protocols**: SAML/SSO, OAuth2, OIDC
- **Concepts**: RBAC, JWT, API Security, Audit Logging
- **Compliance**: FERPA, data privacy best practices

## Education

### University of Maryland, Baltimore County (UMBC)
**Master of Science in Computer Science** (2023 – 2025)
- GPA: 3.9/4.0
- Relevant Coursework: Data Structures, Computational Models, Machine Learning, Cloud Computing

### Vellore Institute of Technology (VIT)
**Bachelor of Technology in Computer Science** (2018 – 2022)
- Specialization in Data Analytics
- Research focus on Machine Learning and AI applications

## Certifications

- **Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate (AI-102)** - 2024
- **Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Scientist Associate (DP-100)** - 2024
- **Azure Fundamentals (AZ-900)** - 2023

## Leadership & Activities

- **UMBC CYBR Research Assistant** - Contributing to cybersecurity research initiatives
- **Hackathon Mentor** - Guiding student teams in building technical solutions
- **Student Builder Coach** - Supporting aspiring developers in their learning journey

## Projects & Research

My work spans various domains including:
- **Cybersecurity Infrastructure**: CyberRange Portal for academic lab provisioning
- **AI Applications**: Real-time interview platform with conversational AI
- **Healthcare Analytics**: Influenza outbreak prediction using deep learning
- **IoT Systems**: Smart home automation with facial recognition
- **Financial ML**: Stock price prediction using LSTM networks

## Get in Touch

I'm always interested in discussing new opportunities, collaborations, or just chatting about technology. Feel free to reach out!

- **Location**: Baltimore, MD
- **Email**: nithinpoolareddy@gmail.com
- **LinkedIn**: [linkedin.com/in/nithinpoolareddy](https://www.linkedin.com/in/nithinpoolareddy)
- **GitHub**: [github.com/poolanithinreddy](https://github.com/poolanithinreddy)

## Download Résumé

[Download the PDF →](/resume.pdf)

## Systems engineer with academic cyber defense roots

I build platforms that keep classrooms, analysts, and product teams shipping safely—from distributed VMware lab automation to realtime AI experiences. UMBC’s CyberRange Portal remains the crown jewel: I owned the full stack (Next.js, Node/Express, Mongo/Postgres, VMware vCenter automation, SAML/SSO, Docker/NGINX, observability) and delivered production reliability for faculty and students.

## Experience highlights

### Software Engineer Intern — UMBC College of Engineering & IT (2023 – 2024)
- Architected and shipped the CyberRange Portal, replacing manual VMware scripts with a self-service Next.js platform
- Automated vCenter provisioning, SAML SSO mappings, Docker/NGINX deployments, logging, and metrics pipelines
- Reduced lab onboarding from weeks to minutes while satisfying FERPA audit requirements

### Graduate Assistant & Grader — UMBC (2023)
- Supported CMSC 481 (Computational Models) coursework with systems-focused labs and tutorials

### Web Development Intern — Oasis Infobyte (2022)
- Delivered responsive React dashboards and REST APIs for client projects

### Data Science Intern — Small Talk (2021)
- Built predictive models and dashboards supporting customer engagement analytics

## Skills that go beyond the buzzwords

- **Full-stack**: Next.js 14, TypeScript, Tailwind, shadcn/ui, React Three Fiber, Contentlayer/MDX
- **Backend & Systems**: Node/Express, FastAPI, tRPC, GraphQL, WebRTC, Redis, PostgreSQL, MongoDB
- **Automation & Infra**: VMware vCenter + PowerCLI, Docker/NGINX, GitHub Actions, Kubernetes basics, Terraform
- **Data & ML**: Python, PyTorch/TensorFlow, Azure ML, MLflow, LangChain, analytics pipelines
- **Security & Auth**: SAML/SSO, OAuth2/OIDC, RBAC design, audit logging, compliance reporting

## Certifications & achievements

- Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate (AI-102)
- Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Scientist Associate (DP-100)
- UMBC CYBR research assistantships and cybersecurity competition mentoring

## Outside the editor

I’m based in Baltimore, MD, coaching student builders, mentoring hackathon teams, and helping faculty stand up resilient infrastructure. When I’m not tuning provisioning pipelines, you’ll find me iterating on AI interview tooling or rebuilding lab topologies in 3D.

## Download résumé

[Download the PDF →](/resume.pdf)
